alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 27 at 2:23PM MST until January 27 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West to southwest winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Dangerous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Blizzard Warning is also in effect until 8 PM MST this evening. Significant blowing and drifting snow is likely with near zero visibilities possible at times. Travel will remain extremely dangerous or impossible through tonight.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
